summary.para: This class implements a LinkButton control that may be used inside a .
The COELinkButton class accepts every LinkButton property to be set, but as ICOEGenerable control it also provides GetData(), PutData(), DefaultValue and LoadFromXml() Methods.

list.item: defalutValue: What is the default text?
bindingExpression: What is the binding Attribute, relative to the datasource, of the formgenerator.
label: What is its label?
configInfo: Additional attributes like CSSClass, Style, Width, Height, ID...

summary.code: <formElement> <defaultValue>Resolve This Compound</defaultValue> <bindingExpression/> <serverEvents> <event eventName="Click" handlerName="ResolveLinkButton_Click"/> </serverEvents> <configInfo> <fieldConfig> <CSSClass>COELabelView</CSSClass> <ID>ResolveLinkButton</ID> </fieldConfig> </configInfo> <displayInfo> <top>325px</top> <left>100px</left> <type>CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Controls.COEFormGenerator.COELinkButton</type> </displayInfo> </formElement> </formElements>
summary.para: In this implementation "Default Value", GetData and PutData Methods reffer to the Text property.

Every control that is intended to be rendered by a FormGenerator must implement this interface. In order to allow the proper communication between a FormGenerator containing a control, and the control itself, four members must be implemented:

list.item: GetData method: Defines what is being returned by a control, usually this is as simple as returning the Text property of the base class, but sometimes this method can be quite more complex.

PutData method: Defines where is being set the values (usually) entered by the user. It can be as simple as setting a Text property of the base class, but can be quite more complex, for instance in a GridView implementation.
LoadFromXml method: Each control will need some specific information, is responsibility of each control to define and to understand/parse its own configuration in some xml like format.
DefaultValue property: When the control is initialized this property may be called.

summary.para: This class is used to render an ChemDraw activex, which basically allows to draw and analyze chemical structures, as well as data formatting. This server controls has plenty of the functionality running on client side, but that means that ChemDraw activex must be installed on the client machine.

Other important consideration is that the chemdraw needs to be activated to a PRO license in order to be fully functional. The NET version of it may cause the control to behave in an unexpected manner.

para.i: Adding the control in the html source is as easy as follows:

summary.code:
<%@ Page Language="C#" ... %> <%@ Register Assembly="CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework" Namespace="CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Controls.ChemDraw" TagPrefix="cc1" %>
...
<cc1:COEChemDrawEmbed id="COEChemDrawEmbedControl" runat="server"></cc1:COEChemDrawEmbed>
...

para.i: And to include the control programatically is as simple as:

member.name: T:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.SqlGenerator.Queries.SelectItems.SelectClauseItem
member.summary: Base class for select clause items, like fields or functions to return in a select. This class is intended to be inherited and implemented, and not instanced directly (as it's abstract). It represents a field to be added to the select clause, wich needs certain format. Let's suppose we have the following select: SELECT SUBSTANCEID, MOLWEIGTH(SUBSTANCEID) FROM SUBSTANCES To build this query we would need to instance two SelectClauseItems: one for the substanceid column, and one for the function molweight wich operates on column substanceid.

member.name: M:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.SqlGenerator.Queries.SelectItems.SelectClauseItem.Execute(CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.DBMSType)
member.summary: Basically execute should call the method GetDependantString after setting the database type. if any other functionality is needed the method may be overriden.
member.param: The database type. I.E.: Oracle 9i, MSSQL 2005, a member of enumeration DBMSType enum.
member.returns: A string representing this part of the clause select. I.E.: MolWeight(MoleculeID)

member.name: M:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.SqlGenerator.Queries.SelectItems.SelectClauseItem.GetDependantString(CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.DBMSType)
member.summary: This method must be overriden to return a representation of this part of the select clause. If different strings are needed for different databases, this should be solved here.
member.returns: A string representing this part of the clause select for the specific database. I.E.: CONVERT(101, '6/8/2006') or (DateTime)"6/8/2006" "

summary.para: This class implements an infragistics' UltraWebGrid that gets the doc manager (v11) documents associated to a registration record and may be used inside a .
The COEDocManager class accepts every UltraWebGrid property to be set, but as ICOEGenerable control it also provides GetData(), PutData(), DefaultValue and LoadFromXml() Methods.

list.item: defalutValue: What value would be the default reg number?
bindingExpression: What is the binding Attribute, relative to the datasource, of the formgenerator.
label: What is its label?
configInfo: Additional attributes like CSSClass, Style, Width, Height, ID...

summary.code: <formElement> <label>Doc Manager associated documents:</label> <bindingExpression>RegNumber.RegNum</bindingExpression> <configInfo> <fieldConfig> <CSSClass>COELabelView</CSSClass> <CSSLabelClass>COELabelTitle</CSSLabelClass> <CSSLinkClass>COELabelTitle</CSSLinkClass> <Protocol>http</Protocol> <TargetURL>%2Fdocmanager%2Fdocmanager%2Fexternallinks%2FgetDocumentsNoGUI.asp</TargetURL> <AddDocsURL>%2Fdocmanager%2Fdefault.asp%3Fdataaction%3Ddb%26formgroup%3Dbase_form_group%26dbname%3Ddocmanager%26extAppName%3DChem_Reg%26LinkType%3DCHEMREGREGNUMBER%26linkfieldname%3DROOT_NUMBER%26showselect%3Dtrue%26extlinkid%3D</AddDocsURL> <ReturnType>xml</ReturnType> <LinkType>CHEMREGREGNUMBER</LinkType> <LinkTarget>_blank</LinkTarget> <DeleteItemText>Delete</DeleteItemText> <ShowLogo>false</ShowLogo> <EmptyGridMessage>No documents links currently exists.</EmptyGridMessage> <ShowSubmitDate>true</ShowSubmitDate> <Columns> <Column key='Name' width='80px'/> <Column key='Link' width='0px'/> <Column key='DocName' width='250px'/> <Column key='Owner' width='80px'/> <Column key='Date' type='Button' width='200px'/> <Column key='Delete' width='100px'/> </Columns> </fieldConfig> </configInfo> <displayInfo> <top>325px</top> <left>5px</left> <type>CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Controls.COEFormGenerator.COEDocManagerClassic</type> </displayInfo> </formElement>

para.b: The xml examples are based on the "Classic" implementation of DocManager, because version 11 of DocManager is still unavailable.

summary.para: In this implementation "Default Value", and PutData Methods reffer to the registry number, and GetData reffers to the documents associated to that registration number.

member.name: M:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Controls.COEFormGenerator.COEDocManager.LoadFromXml(System.String)
member.summary:
Loads its specific configuration from an xml in the form:
<fieldConfig> <CSSClass>COELabelView</CSSClass> <CSSLabelClass>COELabelTitle</CSSLabelClass> <CSSLinkClass>COELabelTitle</CSSLinkClass> <Protocol>http</Protocol> <TargetURL>%2Fdocmanager%2Fdocmanager%2Fexternallinks%2FgetDocumentsNoGUI.asp</TargetURL> <AddDocsURL>%2Fdocmanager%2Fdefault.asp%3Fdataaction%3Ddb%26formgroup%3Dbase_form_group%26dbname%3Ddocmanager%26extAppName%3DChem_Reg%26LinkType%3DCHEMREGREGNUMBER%26linkfieldname%3DROOT_NUMBER%26showselect%3Dtrue%26extlinkid%3D</AddDocsURL> <ReturnType>xml</ReturnType> <LinkType>CHEMREGREGNUMBER</LinkType> <LinkTarget>_blank</LinkTarget> <DeleteItemText>Delete</DeleteItemText> <ShowLogo>false</ShowLogo> <EmptyGridMessage>No documents links currently exists.</EmptyGridMessage> <ShowSubmitDate>true</ShowSubmitDate> <Columns> <Column key='Name' width='80px'/> <Column key='Link' width='0px'/> <Column key='DocName' width='250px'/> <Column key='Owner' width='80px'/> <Column key='Date' type='Button' width='200px'/> <Column key='Delete' width='100px'/> </Columns> </fieldConfig>

summary.para: This class allows the user to perform a CsCartridge.MolWeight SQL Statement. Which is implemented only in Oracle by now.
The SelectClauseMolWeight class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field DataField: The field where is located the molecule structure.
string CartridgeSchema: The name of the cartridge schema.

summary.para: This class supports only Oracle cartridge implementation. SelectClauses are implemented in two differentiable parts: The SelectClause itself, in charge of generating the string and a Parser whose responsibility is to extract the information needed for building the clause from an xmlnode. All SelectClause are mapped in mappings.xml, wich indicates given a SelectClause name, wich class to use for parsing and obtaining the generated string. There is a set of predefined SelectClauseItems, but the user can expand with his own. By implementing SelectClauseItem and ISelectClauseParser and adding the corresponding entry in this file. Along with SelectClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <CsCartridgeMolWeight fieldId="20" CartridgeSchema="CSCARTRIDGE" />
summary.para: This code will produce the following select clause statement:
CSCARTRIDGE.MolWeight(inv_compounds.base64_cdx, '')

summary.para: In this namespaces there are several classes intended for Form Generation. The following controls are already implemented:

list.item: COECheckBox: A checkbox for the FormGenerator.
COECheckBoxReadOnly: A read only checkbox for the FormGenerator.
COEChemDraw: A ChemDrawEmbed for the FormGenerator.
COEChemDrawEmbedReadOnly: A read only ChemDrawEmbed for the FormGenerator.
COEDatePicker: An infragistics' DatePicker for the FormGenerator.
COEDatePickerReadOnly: An infragistics' read only DatePicker for the FormGenerator.
COEDocManager: A docmanager for the FormGenerator.
COEDocManagerClassic: A docmanager classic for the FormGenerator.
COEDropDownList: A dropdownlist for the FormGenerator
COEFormGenerator: A container that is capable of dinamically rendering several based on an xml definition.
COEFormGeneratorManager: A holder that allows to manipulate several form generators into a single xml definition.
COEFormGeneratorRepeater: A repeater.
COEGridView: A gridview for the FormGenerator.
COELabel: A label for the FormGenerator.
COELinkButton: A linkbutton for the FormGenerator.
COERadioButton: A radiobutton for the FormGenerator.
COETexArea: A multiline TextBox for the FormGenerator.
COETextAreaReadOnly: A read only multiline TextBox for the FormGenerator.
COETextBox: A TextBox for the FormGenerator.
COETextBoxReadOnly: A read only TextBox for the FormGenerator.
COETextEdit: An infragistic's textbox for the FormGenerator.
COEUrlControl: Unknown.

summary.para: Some interfaces are also provided to allow thid party controls to be plugged into a FormGenerator:

list.item: ICOEContainer: Mark a control as holder of controls and that allows the use of Datasources and pagging.
ICOECultureable: Mark a control as cultureable, meaning that the control will behave different for each CultureInfo.
ICOEGenerableControl: This is the main interface and is mandatory to implement, it defines de basic capabilities needed to be rendered by a FormGenerator.
ICOELabelable: Mark the control as labelable.
ICOERequireable: Defines that the control may be required, and may behave different if it is required.

summary.para: In this namespaces there are several classes intended for Chemimcal drawing.

Base namespace. It encapsulates all the tasks requied for generating executable SQL queries in the form of prepared statements (that means, the query text on one side and the parameters in the other) whether from xml input or programmatically.

Metadata namespace contains classes DataView, ResultCriteria and SearchCriteria. These classes are responsible for creating a query based upon the corresponding input xmls: DataView.xml, ResultCriterial.xml and SearchCriteria.xml (or the MessagingType that represents them). For this purpose, these classes use the classes contained in the query. The DataView, class besides parsing the input xml, stores the database schema required for this query. It translates ids to names, solves relationships between tables, etc. Both ResultCriteria and SearchCriteria use the following approach for parsing: They iterate through the items of the xml, and extract the xml tag of that portion. This is passed as parameter to a factory that knows wich class to instanciate depending on the type of item and returns it. The resulting item is then added to the query. ResultsCriteria differs in that the user can provide new plug-in based resultsCriteria. For this, the user must supply an assembly containing the item itself and a parser, required for creating the item from xml. Also, this plug-in has to be registered in the file mappings.xml.
This namespace wraps the functionality of the quickgraph library, needed for resolving tables relationships from the dataview.

This namespace contains the required classes for producing a SQL Select Statement targeted to a given DataBase. Currently supports Oracle, MS-Access and MS-SQL Server.
This classes only manipulate strings, and don't have any additional "inteligence".
The Design of this classes follow a Command Pattern: The Main class contains an array of Commands. Each Command implements an "Execute" Method. When the main class is asked to perform its task, ir loops the array calling the execute method of every command that was added to it.
In this case, the main class is Query, and the "Execute method" is called GetDependantString. In this case, there are two arrays of commands: one for the select clause and other for the where clause.
When you want to retrieve the sql query string, you call GetDependantString on Query, which in turn calls it on every command it contains.

This namespace contains the required classes for producing a SQL Statement that are not Select (Queries), targeted to a given DataBase. Currently supports Oracle, MS-Access and MS-SQL Server.
This classes only manipulate strings, and don't have any additional "inteligence".
The Design of this classes follow a Command Pattern, with the difference that the method to be called is named GetDependantString instead of Execute.
Currently there are two NonQueries implemented:

list.item: Insert statement
Truncate statement

summary.para: When you want to retrieve the sql nonquery string, you call GetDependantString on NonQuery, which in turn calls it on every command it contains.

Select items of a query (Single Field, Literal, MAX(Field), ISNULL(...), etc. Anything that can go in the select part of the statement.
Analog to WhereClauseItems with the exception that the user can supply it's own commands here, as plug-ins located in a separate assembly.
Where items of a query (Comparisons, IN, ISNULL, etc.). Anything that can go in the where part of the query statement. Analog to SelectClauseItems

Numerous utilities needed for making our life easier :). Convertion from db-specific types to abstracts like numeric, text, date, etc. Data Manipulation functions like trims of numeric values, chemical normalizations, etc. Special Characters Handling.

summary.para: This class implements a TextBox control in Singleline mode that may be used inside a .
The COETextBox class accepts every TextBox property to be set, but as ICOEGenerable control it also provides GetData(), PutData(), DefaultValue and LoadFromXml() Methods.

list.item: defalutValue: What is the default text of the textbox?
bindingExpression: What is the binding Attribute, relative to the datasource, of the formgenerator.
label: What is its label?
configInfo: Additional attributes like CSSClass, Style, Width, Height, ID...

summary.para: COEFormGenerator is the core class of this namespace. It is a control that is capable of rendering dinamically a Form definition. That means that if that definition is changed in runtime, the resulting rendered form will automatically adopt the new layout and control's change. That Form Definition is specified by the class and defines which controls will be rendered in which modes and also where in the screen. Additionally binding expressions may be defined for each control to control the databinding process. This last means that the form generator may be bound to a Datasource (or datasourceid), and is capable of reading and writing values from and to the datasource.
This interface defines methods and properties that are usefull for those controls that are intended to contain other controls, and moreover, that may contain datasources.
Triggers the databinding process.
If used with DataSourceID this should start its datasource update process, otherwise it should fire some "Updating" events.
Gets or set the container's display mode. Every container should allow one of the following modes:

list.item: Add
Edit
Query
View

summary.para: If the container will have pagging capabilities, this property should be implemented to get or set the current page index.
Gets or sets if the container should be rendered or not.
Gets or sets the container's datasource.
Gets or sets the container's datasourceid.

This methods will trigger the update process through the binding datasource. If datasourceid is being used, then its dataview.Update methods is called, otherwise ItemUpdating and ItemUpdated events are fired.

member.name: T:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.SqlGenerator.Utils.NormalizationUtils
member.summary: Provides methods to normalize strings.

member.name: M:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.SqlGenerator.Utils.NormalizationUtils.GetSearchRange(System.String,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Examines the provided string, which represents a real number, possibly in exponential notation, and determines the number of significant figures present. In the conventional simple and scientific representations of real numbers, there is one region within the string that represents the significant digits. The position of this region given by (start,finish).
To determine this region: 1) Locate the decimal point. 2) Remove a leading minus or plus sign.
3) Remove leading zeroes. 4) Strip off everything including and following an exponent (E). 5) If a decimal point is not present, strip off trailing zeroes. 6) Count the number of characters left, ignoring any decimal point. 7) Every number is considered to have *at least* one significant figure.
Examples of "significant regions" are: "-003.14E01" -> "3.14", 3 sig figs. "0.0300" -> ".0300", 3 sig figs. "3020" -> "3020", 3 sig figs. ".00E-7" -> ".00", 1 sig figs.
Penned by HEH, 12/15/95. Ported by DGB, 7/2003. Ported by fgaldeano to C#, 9/2005. Fixed by llillo 10/2005.
member.param: The string containing the representation of the original value.

summary.para: This class implements a IN operator in a SQL where clause. This Class is designed to handle lots of input, thats why a temporary table strategy is used, if possible (in access this is not possible). Also, an approximated row count (cardinality) is calculated and inserted into the clause, for purposes of DBMS Query optimization.
The WhereClauseBetween class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value [] Values: represents the array values against wich the dataField is being compared.

summary.para: The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <searchCriteriaItem id="1" fieldid="27" modifier="" tableid="6"> <numericalCriteria operator="IN">12, 13, 14</numericalCriteria> </searchCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
MolId IN( SELECT /*+ cardinality(t 10)*/ * FROM TABLE(CAST(STR2TBL(:1) as MYTABLETYPE)) t WHERE ROWNUM >= 0)
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value("12", DbType.Int32)
Value("13", DbType.Int32)
Value("24", DbType.Int32)

summary.para: This class implements a LIKE comparison operator in a SQL where clause.
The WhereClauseLike class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField: Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value Val: represents the value against wich the dataField is being compared. Its value and type are required. The type of the field can differ from the type of the value.
bool CaseSensitive: flag that indicates whether take into account casing or not.
Position TrimPosition: flag that indicates how to perform the trim of value. Posible Values: Left, Right, Both, None.

summary.para: The WhereClause decides whether its TextCriteria, NumericalCriteria, etc. based upon the Val Value field. This Where Clause can take into account casing and can perform trim of the input value. In the special case of a numericalCriteria that is applied into a text database field, the trim operation trims leading and or trailing zeroes (instead of just spaces). In the case of a TextCriteria, this implementation compares the ascii codes of the strings.
summary.code: <structureCriteriaItem id=XX fieldid=20 modifier='' tableid=3> <textCriteria operator='LIKE' trim='BOTH' caseSensitive='NO'> C1CCCCC1 </textCriteria> </structureCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
[AND] (LOWER(Structure) LIKE :0);
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value(c1ccccc1, DataFieldtype.Text

summary.para: This class represents a literal text the user wants to add to the select clause.
The SelectClauseLiteral class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: string Literal: The text that is going to be added to the columns of the query.

summary.para: SelectClauses are implemented in two differentiable parts: The SelectClause itself, in charge of generating the string and a Parser whose responsibility is to extract the information needed for building the clause from an xmlnode. All SelectClause are mapped in mappings.xml, wich indicates given a SelectClause name, wich class to use for parsing and obtaining the generated string. There is a set of predefined SelectClauseFields, but the user can expand with his own. By implementing SelectClauseItem and ISelectClauseParser and adding the corresponding entry in this file. Along with SelectClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <literal>literal</literal>
summary.para: This code will produce the following select clause statement:
'literal'

summary.para: This class allows the user to perform a Switch (CASE or DECODE) SQL Statement.
The SelectClauseCase class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: List<SelectClauseItem> Clauses: The SelectClauseItems to be concatenated.
SelectClauseItem Clause: The SelectClauseItem used for the swich condition.
SortedDictionary<string, SelectClauseItem> Cases: A Dictionary of switch possible cases, where the string key is to be used as the case and the SelectClauseItem is the result.
SelectClauseItem Default: The default result.

summary.para: This class doesnt support Access yet, and will throw an exception if used on that dbms. SelectClauses are implemented in two differentiable parts: The SelectClause itself, in charge of generating the string and a Parser whose responsibility is to extract the information needed for building the clause from an xmlnode. All SelectClause are mapped in mappings.xml, wich indicates given a SelectClause name, wich class to use for parsing and obtaining the generated string. There is a set of predefined SelectClauseFields, but the user can expand with his own. By implementing SelectClauseItem and ISelectClauseParser and adding the corresponding entry in this file. Along with SelectClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <switch inputType="text"> <clause> <field id ="2"/> </clause> <condition value="123"> <field id ="2"/> </condition> <condition value="aBb"> <literal>12323</literal> </condition> <condition value="C"> <literal>'12323'</literal> </condition> <condition default=""> <field id="1"/> </condition> </switch>
summary.para: This code will produce the following select clause statements:
In Oracle: DECODE (e.NAME, 'JOHN', Literal Name, 'SMITH', e.LASTNAME, e.LASTNAME)
In MS-SQLSERVER: case e.NAME WHEN 'JOHN' THEN 'Literal Name' WHEN 'SMITH' THEN e.LASTNAME ELSE e.LASTNAME END
To Be Done: Review the SelectClauses Aliases (In this case there is no place to put it on the xml). And Implement this in Ms-Asccess.

The COEDatePicker class accepts every WebDateChooser property to be set, but as ICOEGenerable control it also provides GetData(), PutData(), DefaultValue and LoadFromXml() Methods. All dates are stored internally as Universal Time amd converted based on .

summary.para: This class implements a less than comparison operator, ">" or >=, in a SQL where clause.
The WhereClauseLessThan class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField: Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value Val: represents the value against wich the dataField is being compared. Its value and type are required. The type of the field can differ from the type of the value.
bool GreaterEqual: flag that indicates whether its > or >=.
bool CaseSensitive: flag that indicates whether take into account casing or not.
Position TrimPosition: flag that indicates how to perform the trim of value. Posible Values: Left, Right, Both, None.

summary.para: The WhereClause decides whether its TextCriteria, NumericalCriteria, etc. based upon the Val Value field. This Where Clause can take into account casing and can perform trim of the input value. In the special case of a numericalCriteria that is applied into a text database field, the trim operation trims leading and or trailing zeroes (instead of just spaces). In the case of a TextCriteria, this implementation compares the ascii codes of the strings.

The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <structureCriteriaItem id=XX fieldid=19 modifier= tableid=3> <numericalCriteria operator='GTE' trim='BOTH'>00012.0000 </numericalCriteria> </structureCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
[AND] (MolWeight >= :0);
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value(12, DataFieldtype.Float)

summary.para: This is the read only version of .

bindingExpression: What is the binding Attribute, relative to the datasource, of the formgenerator.
label: What is its label?
configInfo: Additional attributes like CSSClass, Style, Width, Height, ID...

summary.para: This class permits the user to insert its SQL clause textually, while sticking to the prepared statement overall design.
The WhereClauseIn class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: string Verbatim: Represents Literal (or Verbatim) SQL text that the user wants to add to the query. Parameters must be incated by using the parameter marker
List<Value> Parameters:: represents the array values that will populate the query when executing, at a later stage (and a different subsystem).

summary.para: The Field and the Values array are ignored in this implementation. This class is not guaranteed to be present in future implementations, as it poses high security problems (SQL Injection, etc.) The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <searchCriteriaItem id="1" fieldid="1" tableid="1" modifier=""> <verbatimCriteria> <verbatim>myTable.MyField = ? AND myTable.MyOtherField = ?</verbatim> <parameter>12</parameter> <parameter>lelele</parameter> </verbatimCriteria> </searchCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
myTable.MyField = :0 AND myTable.MyOtherField = :1
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value("12", DbType.Int32)
Value("lelele", System.Data.DbType.String)

member.summary: Initializes its values to its default values.

member.summary: Gets the string representation of the verbatim clause for the given database, and adds the param values to the values list.

Already existent values of a query.
member.returns: The string representation of the clause.

member.summary: Gets or sets the verbatim value.

member.name: P:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.SqlGenerator.Queries.WhereItems.WhereClauseVerbatim.Parameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of parameters.

summary.para: This class implements a IN operator in a SQL where clause. This Class is designed to handle lots of input, thats why a temporary table strategy is used, if possible (in access this is not possible). Also, an approximated row count (cardinality) is calculated and inserted into the clause, for purposes of DBMS Query optimization.
The WhereClauseIn class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value [] Values: represents the array values against wich the dataField is being compared.

summary.para: The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <searchCriteriaItem id="1" fieldid="27" modifier="" tableid="6"> <numericalCriteria operator="IN">12, 13, 14</numericalCriteria> </searchCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
MolId IN( SELECT /*+ cardinality(t 10)*/ * FROM TABLE(CAST(STR2TBL(:1) as MYTABLETYPE)) t WHERE ROWNUM >= 0)
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value("12", DbType.Int32)
Value("13", DbType.Int32)
Value("24", DbType.Int32)

summary.para: This class implements a FormulaContains operator, which is an Oracle depandant query. The query is of type "CartridgeSchema.FormulaContains(fld, formula, options)=1.
The WhereClauseFormula class required the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField: Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value Val: represents the formula against which the dataField is being compared. Its value and type are required.
bool FullWordSearch: flag that indicates whether its full or not. This is passed to options SQL parameter.
String CartridgeSchema: This should be the name of the schema for the Cs Cartridge. By default it is set to CsCartridge.

summary.para: This implementation will work on Oracle database only and will throw an exception if other database is used. The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <searchCriteriaItem id=XX fieldid=20 modifier= tableid=3> <FormulaCriteria> <CsCartridgeFormulaCriteria Full=NO>c1ccccc1 </CsCartridgeFormulaCriteria> </FormulaCriteria> <searchCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
[AND] (CSCARTRIDGE.FormulaContains(:1, :2, :3)=1);
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value(Base64_cdx, DataFieldtype.Text),
Value(c1ccccc1, DataFieldtype.Text),
Value(FULL=YES, DataFieldtype.Text)

summary.para: To Be Done: There is no way to define the CartridgeSchema in the xml. We should extend the xml to allow for it.

member.name: P:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Common.SearchCriteria.StructureCriteria.Query8000

summary.para: This class implements a less than comparison operator, "<" or "<=", in a SQL where clause.
The WhereClauseLessThan class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField: Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value Val: represents the value against wich the dataField is being compared. Its value and type are required. The type of the field can differ from the type of the value.
bool LessEqual: flag that indicates whether its < or <=.
bool CaseSensitive: flag that indicates whether take into account casing or not.
Position TrimPosition: flag that indicates how to perform the trim of value. Posible Values: Left, Right, Both, None.

summary.para: The WhereClause decides whether its TextCriteria, NumericalCriteria, etc. based upon the Val Value field. This Where Clause can take into account casing and can perform trim of the input value.

The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <structureCriteriaItem id=XX fieldid=21 modifier='' tableid=3> <textCriteria operator='LTE' trim='BOTH' caseSensitive='NO'>00012.0000 </textCriteria> </structureCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
[AND] (Formula < :0)
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value(C1CCCC1, DataFieldtype.Text)

member.summary: Encapsulates different sintaxis for the underlying RDBMS. If the equal will be case insensitive, then a lower is applied to the field and the value is lowered too.

summary.para: This class implements an Infragistics' WebTextEdit control that may be used inside a .
The COETextEdit class accepts every Infragistics' WebTextEdit property to be set, but as ICOEGenerable control it also provides GetData(), PutData(), DefaultValue and LoadFromXml() Methods.

list.item: defalutValue: What is the default value of the text edit?
bindingExpression: What is the binding Attribute, relative to the datasource, of the formgenerator.
label: What is its label?
configInfo: Additional attributes like CSSClass, Style, Width, Height, ID...

summary.code: <formElement> <label>Optical Rotation</label> <bindingExpression>PropertyList[@Name='OPTICALROTATION' | Value]</bindingExpression> <validationRuleList> <validationRule validationRuleName="textLength" errorMessage="The length must be between 0 and 200"> <params> <param name="min" value="0"/> <param name="max" value="200"/> </params> </validationRule> </validationRuleList> <configInfo> <fieldConfig> <CSSClass>COETextEdit</CSSClass> <CSSLabelClass>COELabel</CSSLabelClass> <ID>OpticalRotationTextEdit</ID> </fieldConfig> </configInfo> <displayInfo> <top>220px</top> <left>15px</left> <type>CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Controls.COEFormGenerator.COETextEdit</type> </displayInfo> </formElement>
summary.para: In this implementation "Default Value", GetData and PutData Methods reffer to the Value property.

summary.para: Main class of the service COEPickListPicker, which provides the ability to retrieve name value list values from database.
This service is mainly intended for those typical cases of retriveing all the allowed status for a particular object or even more typical for retrieving all the countries/states.
For this service to work you have to configure two tables in the schema you are working with.

list.item: PickList: This table contains a list of values for an specific domain. For instance all the values for the domain Country.
PickListDomain: This table contains the list of known domains.

summary.para: Once the tables are set you can start using this service for retrieven the NameValueList for each domain you require.

summary.para: This class represents a simple field.
The SelectClauseField class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField: Represents the field itself that is going to be added to the columns of the query.
int FieldId: The Id of the field DataField. This can be obtained directly from the dataField, and is left only for backward compatibility.
string FieldName: The Name of the field DataField. This can be obtained directly from the dataField, and is left only for backward compatibility.
string TableName: The Table owner of the field DataField. This can be obtained directly from the dataField, and is left only for backward compatibility.

summary.para: SelectClauses are implemented in two differentiable parts: The SelectClause itself, in charge of generating the string and a Parser whose responsibility is to extract the information needed for building the clause from an xmlnode. All SelectClause are mapped in mappings.xml, wich indicates given a SelectClause name, wich class to use for parsing and obtaining the generated string. There is a set of predefined SelectClauseFields, but the user can expand with his own. By implementing SelectClauseItem and ISelectClauseParser and adding the corresponding entry in this file. Along with SelectClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <field id="2" />
summary.i: where the field 2 is called "name" and belongs to "emp" table (whose alias is e) in the dataview defined for this query.
summary.para: This code will produce the following select clause statement:
e.name

member.name: M:CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.COELoggingService.COELog.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Constructor for the COELog service. Checks to see if logging is enabled by checking the calling clients app or web.config file. here we will check the state of the csla global context variable. If it is empty we will look in the local configuration file the app should have the following. The enterpriseLibrary.ConfigurationSource says to point to the framework config file. the coeLoggingConfiguration says to enable and what categories and priorities to log
the actually logging configuration is specified in the COEFrameworkConfig.xml on the application server

summary.para: This class implements an different comparison operator, "<>", in a SQL where clause.
The WhereClauseNotEqual class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField: Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value Val: represents the value against wich the dataField is being compared. Its value and type are required. The type of the field can differ from the type of the value.
bool CaseSensitive: flag that indicates whether take into account casing or not.
Position TrimPosition: flag that indicates how to perform the trim of value. Posible Values: Left, Right, Both, None.

summary.para: The WhereClause decides whether its TextCriteria, NumericalCriteria, etc. based upon the Val Value field. This WhereClause can take into account casing and can perform trim of the input value. In the special case of a numericalCriteria that is applied into a text database field, the trim operation trims leading and or trailing zeroes (instead of just spaces). In the case of a TextCriteria, this implementation compares the ascii codes of the strings.

The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <structureCriteriaItem id=XX fieldid=19 modifier='' tableid=3> <numericalCriteria operator='NOTEQUAL' trim='BOTH'> 00000018 </numericalCriteria> </structureCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
[AND] (MolWeigth <> :0)
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value(18, DataFieldtype.Numerical)

member.summary: Initializes its members to its default values.

member.summary: Encapsulates different sintaxis for the underlying RDBMS. If the equal will be case insensitive, then a lower is applied to the field and the value is lowered too.
member.exception: Thrown when the data type is not Text
member.returns: A string for the underlying RDBMS, in the form of: FieldName = FieldValue

summary.para: This class implements a GridView control that may be used inside a .
The COEGridView class accepts every GridView property to be set, but as ICOEGenerable control it also provides GetData(), PutData(), DefaultValue and LoadFromXml() Methods.

list.item: defalutValue: What is the default caption of the grid?

summary.code: <formElement> <bindingExpression>PercentageList</bindingExpression> <dataSource>PercentageList</dataSource> <configInfo> <fieldConfig> <ID>PercentageGridView</ID> <ReadOnly>false</ReadOnly> <CSSClass>COEGridView</CSSClass> <Style>margin-left:5px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:5px;</Style> <Columns> <Column headerText='Compound #' dataField='DisplayKey' primaryKey='true' /> <Column headerText='Percentage' dataField='Value' primaryKey='false' /> </Columns> </fieldConfig> </configInfo> <displayInfo> <position>relative</position> <type>CambridgeSoft.COE.Framework.Controls.COEFormGenerator.COEGridView</type> </displayInfo> </formElement> </formElements>

summary.para: This class allows the user to perform a CsCartridge.CDXToMolFile SQL Statement. Which is implemented only in Oracle by now.
The SelectClauseCDXToMolFile class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field DataField: The field where is located the molecule structure.
string CartridgeSchema: The name of the cartridge schema.

summary.para: This class supports only Oracle cartridge implementation. SelectClauses are implemented in two differentiable parts: The SelectClause itself, in charge of generating the string and a Parser whose responsibility is to extract the information needed for building the clause from an xmlnode. All SelectClause are mapped in mappings.xml, wich indicates given a SelectClause name, wich class to use for parsing and obtaining the generated string. There is a set of predefined SelectClauseItems, but the user can expand with his own. By implementing SelectClauseItem and ISelectClauseParser and adding the corresponding entry in this file. Along with SelectClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <CsCartridgeCDXToMolFile fieldId="20" CartridgeSchema="CSCARTRIDGE" />
summary.para: This code will produce the following select clause statement:
CSCARTRIDGE.CDXToMolFile(inv_compounds.base64_cdx, '')

member.summary: Initializes its members to its default values.

member.summary: This method does the actual job. In this case returns the cscartridge formula sintaxys.
member.returns: A string containing the select part corresponding to this clause (i.e. the CsCartridge.Molweight(fieldName))

member.summary: Implementation of ISelectClauseParser. Returns an Instance of SelectClauseCDXToMolFile according to the desired xml snippet.

summary.para: This class allows the user to perform a CsCartridge.Formula SQL Statement. Which is implemented only in Oracle by now.
The SelectClauseFormula class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field DataField: The field where is located the molecule structure.
string CartridgeSchema: The name of the cartridge schema.

summary.para: This class supports only Oracle cartridge implementation. SelectClauses are implemented in two differentiable parts: The SelectClause itself, in charge of generating the string and a Parser whose responsibility is to extract the information needed for building the clause from an xmlnode. All SelectClause are mapped in mappings.xml, wich indicates given a SelectClause name, wich class to use for parsing and obtaining the generated string. There is a set of predefined SelectClauseItems, but the user can expand with his own. By implementing SelectClauseItem and ISelectClauseParser and adding the corresponding entry in this file. Along with SelectClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <CsCartridgeFormula fieldId="20" CartridgeSchema="CSCARTRIDGE" />
summary.para: This code will produce the following select clause statement:
CSCARTRIDGE.Formula(inv_compounds.base64_cdx, '')

summary.para: This class implements a MolWeightContains operator, which is an Oracle depandant query. The query is of type "CartridgeSchema.MolWeightContains(fld, massMin, massMax, options)=1.
The WhereClauseMolWeight class required the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField: Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value Val: This value is currently discarded. There is no use in filling it.
double MinMass: The lower mass to compare to.
double MaxMass: The higher mass to compare to.
String CartridgeSchema: This should be the name of the schema for the Cs Cartridge. By default it is set to CsCartridge.

summary.para: This implementation will work on Oracle database only and will throw an exception if other database is used. The Val property is discarded.

The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <searchCriteriaItem id=XX fieldid=20 modifier= tableid=3> <MolWeightCriteria> <CsCartridgeMolWeightCriteria min=100.5 max=200 /> </MolWeightCriteria> <searchCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
[AND] (CSCARTRIDGE.MolWeightContains(:1, :2, :3, :4)=1);
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value(Base64_cdx, DataFieldtype.Text),
Value(100.5, DataFieldtype.Real),
Value(200, DataFieldtype.Real),
Value(, DataFieldtype.Text)

summary.para: To Be Done: There is no way to define the CartridgeSchema in the xml. We should extend the xml to allow for it.

summary.para: This class implements an equal comparison operator, "=", in a SQL where clause.
The WhereClauseEqual class requires the following members to be initialized to the desired value:

list.item: Field dataField: Represents the field of the database that is being compared. Its name and type are required.
Value Val: represents the value against wich the dataField is being compared. Its value and type are required. The type of the field can differ from the type of the value.
bool CaseSensitive: flag that indicates whether take into account casing or not.
Position TrimPosition: flag that indicates how to perform the trim of value. Posible Values: Left, Right, Both, None.

summary.para: The WhereClause decides whether its TextCriteria, NumericalCriteria, etc. based upon the Val Value field. This WhereClause can take into account casing and can perform trim of the input value. In the special case of a numericalCriteria that is applied into a text database field, the trim operation trims leading and or trailing zeroes (instead of just spaces). In the case of a TextCriteria, this implementation compares the ascii codes of the strings.

The SQL generation aims prepared statements rather than simple queries: parameters are not hardcoded into the query text, but marked with a parameter holder character. Parameters are returned in a separate list, ordered by position as they appear in the query. Along with WhereClause component of Query class, this class follows the command pattern, having the GetDependantString(DataBaseType, Values array) method as the Execute Method
summary.code: <structureCriteriaItem id=XX fieldid=19 modifier='' tableid=3> <numericalCriteria operator='EQUAL' trim='BOTH'> 00018.00000 </numericalCriteria> </structureCriteriaItem>
summary.para: This code will produce the following where clause statement:
[AND] (MolWeight = :0)
And will add the following parameters to the query parameter list:

list.item: Value(18, DataFieldtype.Text)
